reviews.review_msg: Kate is extremely nice and means very well but her lectures are BRUTAL. They are dense and informative but you're better off skipping lecture and reviewing her slides + readings as she often gets side tracked and lectures about unexaminable/unassessed materials. Grading is very generous and feedback is excellent, making it difficult to not succeed.

Kate is nice! However, her lectures are painfully boring, I find that she often reads off the slides or goes off topic for 30 minutes. The course itself is straightforward, with some online quizzes and a group project, which was tedious at times. I wouldn't take a course with her again, but I would like to reiterate that she is nice and caring.
class is a snooze fest, group project is tedious and weighted way too much.

Although Kate is a very kind and sweet person, the class itself is very bland and the lectures feel as if they do not need to be over 3 hours long. Her lecturing style was not for me personally as she often rambles and goes off on tangents the final project was also odd and chaotic. She's a very nice person but I avoid a class with her again.

Overall pretty good professor; she was very available to help students and very approachable. Lectures were just very dry. Some group project work involved. Tests this semester were open-book and online, and very straightforward.

Like the others mentioned her lectures are dry and boring, but I will add that she is not exactly clear with instructions regarding assignments or anything. She automatically assumes that we know what to do and how to do it, which sucks. It's difficult to follow lectures as she switches from a topic to another and talks about one slide for 20 mins.

Kate was genuinely passionate about teaching this course, although I found the lectures to be dry and boring as I wasn't interested in the topics covered in the class. However, she is willing to help you out if you are confused with anything related to the class. No need to attend lectures as long as you keep up with the assigned readings.

Kate is a great professor and she really cares about her students. She tries to provide as much support as she can and she really wants you to be successful in this class. The only downside is the lecture content is quite long and dry. But other than that, everything is great. Highly recommend taking her class!!!

Kate is very caring and nice. However, like one or two of the review say, the lectures are dry. They are so boring, I usually only end up going to the first hour and then leaving. Paper rubric could have been clearer. Grading criteria is nice: 2 online tests, 1 small paper, online weekly participation, and a big group project.

Kate is a standard professor, not amazing and not bad. She is very caring and very open about her political beliefs, personally, I find it unprofessional. Nonetheless, her class was boring, I stopped attending after the first week, just make sure you do the readings. Very low effort, 2 tests and one huge group work.

Although Kate is very nice and helpful, the way the course was run was very irritating. It was kept online even though rest of campus was in person, which made working on the group project very hard (we had no say in this) so I wouldnt recommend taking this until everything is back to normal. Content is quite boring but easy

Very nice prof that allows conversation in class. Lots of negative replies from first year students in intro to health science but that course has always been heavy, even before she taught it. Not sure what they were expecting. If you have her as a prof, youll have a good semester.
The way this class was run remotely was very bad, in person might be better but that class was not great. Dont recommend taking it if you dont have to.

Kate is a nice person but this class is poorly designed. The requirement is very vague. The second midterm is somewhat intense, but all you need is to prepare a template based on the example from the textbook for the written response. It is not a safe choice for GPA booster, whereas it is a course you can get B/B+ with a minimal amount of effort.
Sweetest prof, really cares about her students and is willing to listen to concerns and feedback. Easy class with two quizzes, a paper, and a group project.

She is very sweet and encouraging but SO boring. She came to class late a lot and as a result our class started showing up later and later which felt like a waste of time when I was always there early. The exams were WAY harder than expected and I don't feel that she prepared us for them. The group project was a lot of work and quite a hassle.

Her lectures are sometimes useless since you can just review from the lecture's slides. It is good that she does not take attendance. Her quiz and midterm are fairly easy, you will need to know the theories clearly (The points). Proposal contributes the most, it is long but it is worth doing but it requires some times. Overall, very caring.

She has a nice welcoming personality however, she is a very disorganized prof who came to class late at least half of the semester.. makes you wonder if she takes the course seriously enough. She talks a lot about her personal life. Class is based on THEORIES and grading criteria is unclear. I would not recommend this class as an UD HSCI elective.

Very nice, but not a great prof. She's consistently late for classes and reads her notes straight off the lecture slides, so theres really no point coming to class. Is very disorganized and seems kind of frantic at times. Wouldn't recommend, but she's usually the only one teaching this course.
The worst professor I've had in my entire undergrad at SFU. Always late to class and unorganized. Hard on marking and very detailed prof. Her lectures are useless.

Very disorganized prof. Does not specify what she wants on her assignments and does not explain thoroughly. Talks about random things that are not important to the lecture. Does not give time for groups to get together and work on group project, which is worth a lot.

The worst professor I've had in my entire undergrad at SFU.  Regarding previous comments, "nice" and "kind" doesn't mean she's a good at her job.  Disorganized, patronizing at times (even had the audacity to throw a TA under the bus), I would not recommend taking ANY courses with her.

This was definitely a GPA booster class.  She was really passionate about the subject, unfortunately attending class was pointless because she just rambled & added no value to the grade. You can skip class, take the quizzes, and do the group project (you really don't need to go to class for this - only for her instructions on the group project).

She is nice and tries to be helpful but is very confusing when giving instructions. Her answers to your questions can be long winded and subsequently may be unclear and unhelpful. Don't be fooled; the "quizzes" are more like exams, so study! The group project has many components and  is worth a lot so make sure you find a good group too!
emotional, long exams, and more really don't like  her.
BIG TALKER!!! She can talk all day long nonstop, even before exam!!

Passionate about the course. HOWEVER. It is clear that she has other more important commitments outside of teaching. Expects too much for the group project which is worth a huge chunk of your grade. Rambles too much in lecture.

Kate is an amazing person, prof, and friend to everyone. 312 tries to be a "practical" course, to teach you a skill that you would use in real life (like in co-op). Easy course, useful outside academia, and friendly prof. You'll think its a waste of time during class though, material is boring. She tries to make it interesting.

Kate is absolutely TERRIBLE. She makes the lectures all about herself and spends more time trying to make stupid jokes and talking about herself and gets genuinely angry when attention has shifted from her onto something else. The Faculty would be better off without this distasteful professor.

Kate does try hard to become likeable amongst students. This class tends to be all about Kate and she expects us to participatedonate (worth 10%) to her campaigns which she plans without our help. Difficult to reach via email, prefers meeting at coffee shop (discourages office hours). Lectures tend to be useless, very immaturehigh school energy.

During the beginning of the term, we all loved her. As the semester went by, she began to get more and more disorganized. She did not put as much time and thought structuring the projects and quizzes. She spent most of class time talking about her project & using the students for her project. I along with the entire class were very disappointed.

Laura is a very caring professor. She truly cares about her students and really tries to make sure her students are doing well. Her kindness is something I will never forget. She is a great prof and a great person. in terms of the course, it is group work heavy. Midterms were online but are fair. Course assessments are creative and fun

Most of the class will lose 5% participation marks if he does not know your name by the end of the course. Also, do not take this class if you hate group projects. The prof seems to think that all students participate equally when that is often not the case.
very nice professor...knows the diffuculty students go through very concerning...highly recommended

Including the bonus marks, there was never a time where I had less than A- in an assignment, homeowork, or exams. I was expecting to get an A or maybe an A+ in that course. but I got B+. There was no warning of scaling whatsoever. In the end it comes down to a fraction of a percentage that determines diff btwn A+ and B+. too big of a gap for me..
lectures are pointless. he really likes students to participate in class discussion (regardless of class size-can sometime be awkward)
